description.narrative: 105/003 Field Offices have improved capacity and resources to implement multi-sectoral programmes and humanitarian response at sub- national level, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 105/001 Programme Effectiveness.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 105/003 Field Offices have improved capacity and resources to implement multi-sectoral programmes and humanitarian response at sub-national level

description.narrative: UNICEF improved flood preparedness of the WASH sector through an anticipatory action framework to provide timely and effective life-saving support for 130,000 vulnerable;people;(66,118;females, 55,381 children);in Rangpur.In Cox’s Bazar, UNICEF enhanced disaster preparedness and multi-hazard response capacity by;securing US$9.2 million;to implement Emergency Preparedness;and Response Plan. This included;transforming hazard-based contingency plans to multi-hazard response plans to reach 200,000 people including 101,450 females and 50,000 children in camps at risk of natural and human-made disasters. Furthermore, UNICEF contributed to an anticipatory interagency contingency plan coordinated by UNHCR to reach out to 50,000 Rohingya refugees.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/12/2021
